name: Legion of Super Heroes: Lightning Lad Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Lightning Lad was one of the founding members of the Legion of Super Heroes.  In what comic book did he originally appear?
questions.explanation:
'Adventure Comics' #247.

	'Adventure Comics' #247 (dated April 1958) was his first appearance.  In this story only, he was referred to as Lightning Boy.  When the Legion next appeared in 'Adventure Comics' #267 (dated December 1959) his name had been permanently adjusted to Lightning Lad.

questions.text: What is Lightning Lad's birth name?
questions.explanation:
Garth Ranzz.

	Andy Mildner is the voice actor for Lightning Lad on the WB's "Legion of Super Heroes" cartoon, and Calum Worthy is an actor who portrayed Garth on the TV Series "Smallville".

questions.text: What is the name of Lightning Lad's home planet?
questions.explanation:
Winath.

	Winath is where Lightning Lad was born.  Korbal is where he received his power of generating and manipulating electricity.  Earth is where he relocated when he joined the Legion.  Xanthu is a red herring, the home world of another Legion member.

questions.text: In the Legion story, "The Super-Moby Dick of Space!" (1965), Lightning Lad lost one of his limbs.  Which limb was it?
questions.explanation:
Right arm.

	Lightning Lad's right arm was replaced with a metal prosthetic arm.  The metal arm lasted twenty issues until a real arm was regrown in 'Adventure Comics' #351 (December 1966).

questions.text: In an oversized Collectors' Edition of 'Superboy and the Legion of Super Heroes' (dated March 1978), Lightning Lad finally married which fellow Legionnaire?
questions.explanation:
Saturn Girl.

	According to Legion rules, they both were forced to resign as active Legion members after they married.

questions.text: How many siblings does Lightning Lad have?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	Garth has a twin sister (twins are the norm on Lightning Lad's home planet).  They have a brother named Mekt, who was born as a solo baby, a rarity on their world.

questions.text: During the post 'Zero Hour' continuity, Lightning Lad used a different Legion alias.  What was his Legion code name during this time?
questions.explanation:
Live Wire.

	In DC Comics continuity, this Legion is, at one point, referred to as the Legion of Earth-247.  Among fans it can be referred to as the Zero Hour Legion, the Reboot Legion, or the Archie Legion.

questions.text: Lightning Lad has fathered two sets of twins. What are their names?
questions.explanation:
Garridan & Graym and Dacey & Dorritt.

	Originally, Garridan was kidnapped by Darkseid and turned into the longtime Legion enemy named Validus.  Later Legion continuity erased this story line from existence.   Dacey and Dorritt were also erased from continuity with the advent of the Zero Hour reboot.

questions.text: Who replaced Lightning Lad in the Legion during several months he was believed to have been killed in action ('Adventure Comics' #304 through #312 in 1963)?
questions.explanation:
Lightning Lass.

	Through a lightning based ceremony, Proty (Chameleon Boy's pet) sacrificed his existence to resurrect Lightning Lad.

questions.text: In the first early Legion stories, Lightning Lad didn't shoot lightning from his arms/hands, he instead did something specific to create his lightning bolts.  What was it?
questions.explanation:
Clapping his hands.

	The visual depiction of the powers for all three founding Legion members would be altered once the team became a top seller.
